title: 112_s3077
content:
The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act". The Pro Football Hall of Fame's mission is to honor individuals who have made outstanding contributions to professional football, preserve historic documents and artifacts, educate the public about the sport's origin and promote its positive values. The Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963, enshrining a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors including legends like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established in 1963, has 273 members. Three symbols represent membership: a bronze bust, a gold jacket, and a ring. The museum has welcomed 9 million visitors and has expanded multiple times, housing the world's largest football collection. The Pro Football Hall of Fame has a vast collection of over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. It reaches a global audience of 15 million people annually through various channels. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The coins minted under this Act will be legal tender and considered numismatic items as per the specifications in title 31, United States Code. The coins minted under this Act will have designs emblematic of professional football, with inscriptions including the year "2016" and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS.

Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility for each quality, within a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2016.

SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted at a reasonable discount before issuance. All sales of coins issued under this Act will include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. The surcharges will be promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame will be audited for the amounts received. No surcharge will be included for the issuance of any coin under this Act. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to ensure that the issuance of commemorative coins does not exceed the annual limit set by law.
